<title level="1" right="Rules">[Temporary Items](/Rules.aspx?ID=3283)</title>

**Source** [Player Core 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=227) pg. 174 <sup>1.1</sup>

<row gap="medium">
<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">
Several archetypes allow you to prepare temporary items. Much like the [infused](/Traits.aspx?ID=797) items created by [alchemists](/Classes.aspx?ID=56), these temporary items last only a short time before becoming useless. Examples include temporary scrolls created by the [scroll trickster](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=262) and temporary weapons, armor, or adventuring gear created by the [scrounger](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=263).

Temporary items are clearly not up to the same quality as other items, so they typically can’t be sold. If an ability doesn’t list how long a temporary item lasts, the item lasts until the next time you make your [daily preparations](/Rules.aspx?ID=2575). Any effect created by a temporary item also ends at that time if it hasn’t already (unless it’s a permanent effect).
</column>

<column gap="medium">

</column>

</row>
